newsitem.title: USA: Coram says Caremark drops most claims against it.
newsitem.headline: Coram says Caremark drops most claims against it.

text.p: Coram Healthcare Corp. said Monday it received notice from a San Francisco court that Caremark Inc. and Caremark International Inc. had dropped 12 of the 13 causes of action in their countersuit against the health care company.
Caremark thereby relinquished claims for $150 million in damages, indemnification and various forms of injunctive relief sought in the lawsuit filed last June, Coram said.
Caremark Inc. and Caremark International Inc. are now units of MedPartners Inc.

Coram filed the original lawsuit against Caremark in 1995, seeking more than $200 million for alleged fraud and breach of contract in connection with the sale of Caremark's home infusion business to Coram.

The Caremark countersuit alleged fraud, deceptive trade practices, contractual indemnity, breach of contract, misappropriation of trade secrets, breach of confidentiality, violations of the Lanham Act, and false advertising, Coram said.
Caremark's only remaining cause of action in the countersuit seeks $17.25 million allegedly due in connection with the home infusion business sale, Coram said.
Coram said it paid Caremark $309 million in the deal and denies owing any more. It said it "continues its vigorous prosecution of claims" against Caremark.
